newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodian police seize 800 kg of marijuana.
newsitem.headline: Cambodian police seize 800 kg of marijuana.

text.p: Cambodian police seized about 800 kg (1,760 lb) of marijuana at a Phnom Penh home on Saturday and arrested two policemen, officials said.
Police General Skavdavy M. Ly Roun said the wife of one of the two arrested was also being held in connection with the case. Drug processing equipment was also seized.
The marijuana had a street value of up to $2.4 million, officials said. Skavdavy said the seizure could be linked to the seizure of 706 kg (1,550 lb) of marijuana on Thursday.
Eight Cambodians have been charged with trafficking in connection with that case, he said.
Last year, the United States placed Cambodia on its list of leading drug producing and transit countries.
